nodes.documentation:
@notice The heart of the recurring alarm clock.
         1. Check if the caller is the current alarm
         2. Execute the task
         3. Reschedule the alarm
         4. Cleanup

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "msg sender must be a delegate"

devdoc.author: Joseph Reed
devdoc.details: This contract's allows decentralized execution of on-chain recurring tasks. It requires three main components:     1. An external source for calling transactions at future time. This contract uses the Ethereum Alarm Clock (EAC)     2. A payment delegate with the Recurring Transaction scheduled     3. A funded delegated wallet with the payment delegate set as a delegate To calculate the cost of each transaction the supplied gas price oracle determines the current network price times a   multiplierbased on how far in the future the transaction is executed. As long as the delegated wallet has enough funds,  the recurring transactions will continue.

params._EAC: The Ethereum Alarm Clock smart contract responsible for creating decentralized alarms.
params._delegate: The delegate from which to pull alarm payments
params._wallet: The funding wallet, change address, and owner of the deployed alarms

params._limits: The execution limits applied to each decentralized alarm

params._oracle: Attempts to predict the gas price at a future date

params._priorityCaller: The address that receives the alarm fee when it is triggered.

devdoc.title: Recurring Transaction Contract

destroy().notice: Cleans up and destroys the alarm. Any leftover ether is sent to the wallet.

initialize(address,address,address).notice: Uses 'initialize()' instead of a constructor to make use of the clone          factory at https://github.com/optionality/clone-factory. In general, 'initialize()' should be           called directly following the alarm clock deployment through the use of a factory.

setExecutionLimits(uint256[3]).notice: Sets the execution limits for when an alarm can be claimed, called, or cancelled.

setGasPriceOracle(address).notice: Sets the oracle that predicts future gas prices.

setPriorityCaller(address).notice: Sets the priority caller that receives the fee when an alarm is called
